maxaimodel.python.timeseries package

Submodules

maxaimodel.python.timeseries.arima module

class maxaimodel.python.timeseries.arima.Arima(time_col: str, target_col: str, params: Optional[dict] = None, param_grid: Optional[dict] = None, val_periods: int = 10, metric: str = 'mean_squared_error', exog_cols: Optional[list] = None)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Wrapper that act as a basic interface for ARIMA-type models

Args:

time_col (str): column that captures datetime target_col (str): attribute to be forecasted params (dict): a dictionary that captures hyperparameters. Not required if param_grid is defined param_grid (dict): a dictionary that captures list hyperparameters on which grid search is to be performed val_periods (int, optional): validation period, will be used during the tuning phase metric (str, optional): validation metrics as defined in sklearn.metrics. E.g. for RMSE, add mean_squared_error exog_cols (list, optional): list of names of the exogenous variables

Attributes:

training_framework

Methods:

fit: Fit (estimate and tunes) the parameters of the model predict: After a model has been fit predict returns the fitted values

build(params)[source]
fit(data)[source]

Fit (estimate and tunes) the parameters of the model

Args:

data (spark.DataFrame): dataframe with time_col, target_col

Returns:

None

get_model_diagnostics()[source]
get_params()[source]
load()[source]
predict(periods, freq=None, data=None)[source]

After a model has been fit predict, returns the forecasted values

Args:

periods (int): time-steps for which forecast is to be made. freq (str, optional): frequency of forecast. Daily (“D”), Monthly (“M”) etc. data (spark.DataFrame, optional): requires only if exogenous variables are being used.

Returns:

forecast_df (spark.DataFrame)

save(path)[source]
training_framework = 'python'

maxaimodel.python.timeseries.garch module

class maxaimodel.python.timeseries.garch.Garch(time_col: str, target_col: str, params: Optional[dict] = None, param_grid: Optional[dict] = None, val_periods: int = 10, metric: str = 'mean_squared_error', exog_cols: Optional[list] = None)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Wrapper that act as a basic interface for GARCH-type models

Args:

time_col (str): column that captures datetime target_col (str): attribute to be forecasted params (dict): a dictionary that captures hyperparameters. Not required if param_grid is defined param_grid (dict): a dictionary that captures list hyperparameters on which grid search is to be performed val_periods (int, optional): validation period, will be used during the tuning phase metric (str, optional): validation metrics as defined in sklearn.metrics. E.g. for RMSE, add mean_squared_error exog_cols (list, optional): list of names of the exogenous variables

Attributes:

training_framework

Methods:

maxaimodel.python.timeseries.neuroprophet module

class maxaimodel.python.timeseries.neuroprophet.NProphet(time_col: str, target_col: str, params: Optional[dict] = None, param_grid: Optional[dict] = None, val_periods: int = 10, freq: str = 'auto', metric: str = 'mean_squared_error', events: Optional[list] = None, future_regressors: Optional[list] = None, lag_regressors: Optional[list] = None, custom_seasonality: Optional[list] = None)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Wrapper that act as a basic interface for NeuralProphet model Refer: https://neuralprophet.com/html/forecaster.html

Args:

time_col (str): column that captures datetime target_col (str): attribute to be forecasted params (dict): Not required if param_grid is defined. For complete list, refer: https://neuralprophet.com/html/hyperparameter-selection.html param_grid (dict): a dictionary that captures list hyperparameters on which grid search is to be performed val_periods (int, optional): validation period, will be used during the tuning phase freq (str, optional): frequency of time-series metric (str, optional): validation metrics as defined in sklearn.metrics. E.g. for RMSE, add mean_squared_error events (list, optional): list of events exog_cols (list, optional): list of names of the exogenous variables future_regressors (list, optional): external variables which have known future values lag_regressors (list, optional): lagged regressors, only available when the AR-Net is enabled custom_seasonality(list[dict]): list of custom seasonality dicts

Attributes:

training_framework

Methods:

fit: Fit (estimate and tunes) the parameters of the model get_event_df: Returns event DF predict: After a model has been fit predict returns the fitted values

build(params)[source]
fit(data)[source]

Fit (estimate and tunes) the parameters of the model

Args:

data (spark.DataFrame): dataframe with time_col, target_col

Returns:

None

get_model_diagnostics()[source]
get_params()[source]
load()[source]
predict(periods, freq=None, data=None)[source]

After a model has been fit predict, returns the forecasted values

Args:

periods (int): time-steps for which forecast is to be made. freq (str, optional): frequency of forecast. Daily (“D”), Monthly (“M”) etc. data (pd.DataFrame, optional): requires only if exogenous variables are being used.

Returns:

forecast_df (pd.DataFrame)

save(path)[source]
training_framework = 'python'

maxaimodel.python.timeseries.prophet module

class maxaimodel.python.timeseries.prophet.FBProphet(time_col: str, target_col: str, freq, params: Optional[dict] = None, param_grid: Optional[dict] = None, val_periods: int = 10, metric: str = 'mean_squared_error', holidays: Optional[list] = None, holiday_countries: Optional[list] = None, custom_seasonality: Optional[list] = None, extra_regressors: Optional[list] = None)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Wrapper that act as a basic interface for Prophet model Refer: https://facebook.github.io/prophet/docs/seasonality,_holiday_effects,_and_regressors.html

Args:

time_col (str): column that captures datetime target_col (str): attribute to be forecasted params (dict): Not required if param_grid is defined. For complete list, refer: https://neuralprophet.com/html/hyperparameter-selection.html param_grid (dict): a dictionary that captures list hyperparameters on which grid search is to be performed val_periods (int, optional): validation period, will be used during the tuning phase freq (str, optional): frequency of time-series metric (str, optional): validation metrics as defined in sklearn.metrics. E.g. for RMSE, add mean_squared_error holidays (list, optional): list of holiday columns holiday_countries (list, optional): list of holiday countries custom_seasonality (list[dict]): list of custom seasonality dicts extra_regressors (list): list of extra regressors

Attributes:

training_framework

Methods:

fit: Fit (estimate and tunes) the parameters of the model get_event_df: Returns event DF predict: After a model has been fit predict returns the fitted values

build(params)[source]
fit(data)[source]

Fit (estimate and tunes) the parameters of the model

Args:

data (spark.DataFrame): dataframe with time_col, target_col

Returns:

None

After a model has been fit predict, returns the forecasted values

Args:

periods (int): time-steps for which forecast is to be made. freq (str, optional): frequency of forecast. Daily (“D”), Monthly (“M”) etc. data (spark.DataFrame, optional): requires only if exogenous variables are being used.

Returns:

forecast_df (spark.DataFrame)
